ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: This strength of this course is the example-based format -- the instructor did a good job of illustrating concepts with pertinent examples.
I wish that I would have taken this class before I tool ep1 I. The way that the information is presented is far clearer than the way that it was presented in epi I.
The course could use more homework problems to help to learn mathematically based principles in preparation for the final examination. See Below as well.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Amazing instructor - very enthusiastic, passionate, supportive. Made learning the material much easier.
Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Dr. Zheng is a great lecturer. I appreciated both his insight into epidemiology as well as his passion about topics in environmental health.
Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Dr. Zheng is a knowledgeable and intelligent professor. He sincerely wants students to learn and takes the necessary time to make that a priority.

Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Dr. Zheng was such a clear instructor. The way that he presented the information was far clearer than the way that the other epi teachers have presented it in the past. He was able to teach the information in a useful and easily understood and practical way.

Instructor: Tongzhang Zheng  Dr Zheng is very difficult to understand. The material can be somewhat challenging and the language barrier makes it all the more difficult to understand. His knowledge is remarkable, however, and he is an overall excellent instructor.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course provided a good exploration of concepts in epidemiology that relate to environmental health.
It is a good overview of basic epidemiology methods and a great introduction to environmental epidemiology and all of the issues that it encompasses.
This is a course that I wish that I would have taken before epi I. It was terrific in clarifying all of my misunderstandings from the last time I took epi.
I would likely NOT recommend this course due to the barriers discussed above.
